result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone R. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

Count 1 - deft sentenced to 10mos KCJ.  Costs rolled into sentence

Count 2 - deft sentenced to 2mos KCJ concurrent to count 1.  Costs rolled into sentence

Credit for 211 days.  Court authorizes work crew for the deft for the balance of his sentence.  If he fails to comply with work crew, he serve the remainder of the time in jail.

Appeal rights
DNA ordered; notice given to deft
Firearm warning
Voting acknowledgment
Return/Destruction of Exhibits jh
Exhibits S1-S12 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 2/19/16. vm
FINAL
PRELIMINARY
DRAFT NO. 1
Count 2 of the Information - Guilty
Count 1 of the Information - Guilty
Concerning Admission of Fingerprint Report

Defendant Tyrone R. Johnson appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Karen Howell.  Clerk:  JM-9am-11:10am.
MINUTES:  9:15am-Jury sworn-in and instructions given.  9:30am-Opening statements.  9:42am-State's case presented, witnesses sworn-in and testified were:  Jesse G., Andrew S.  Exhibits marked:  1-11.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Testimony of Andrew S completed.  Exhibits 1 thru 11 offered/received.  Jurors released for lunch @ 11:54am; instructed to return @ 1:30pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:41pm.  Testimony resumes - Cody S., P.O. Daniel Maccara, P.O. Ryan Sieker, & Det. Joshua Hecker.  Stipulation re: fingerprint report read into the record.  State rests @ 2:14pm.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Defense moves to dismiss; motion denied by the Court.  Deft wishes to testify; colliquey conducted w/the deft.  Jurors reconvene.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from - deft.  Defense rests @ 3:12pm.  No rebuttal.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Jury instruction conference held.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror - Thomas M.  Jury commences deliberations @ 4:05pm.  Verdict reached @ 4:31pm.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 4:32pm.  Deft found guilty on both counts.  Jury polled.  Jurors released @ 4:36pm.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Court enters judgment on the verdicts.  Bail revoked.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/1/16 @ 10am
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Voir dire commences @ 10:25am.  Court takes a short break @ 11:20am.  Court reconvenes @ 11:32am.  Voir dire continues.  Jury selected @ 11:53am.  Unselected jurors released @ 11:54am.  Selected jurors released @ 12:01pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/16/16.  Miranda Goodchild hrg held.  Testimony taken from P.O. Sieker, Det. Joshua Hecker, Tyrone Johnson (deft), & P.O. Sieker (recalled).  Arguments heard.  Court finds the deft's statement cannot be used in the State's case-in-chief.

State's Amended List of Witnesses and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Andrew Burgoyne
in Support of Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence
of State to Admit "Other Acts" Evidence

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  No new charges have been brought against the deft to date.  Defense renews their motion to dismiss and/or for a bond reduction; both denied by the Court.  JS to remain on for 2/15/16 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg previously held.  Special Pros K R Wells reports new burglary charges are forthcoming; also Shenanigan's Store.  State may be filing a motion for joinder on this file as well as the new charges.  Court sets case over.  FPT 1/22/16 @ 11am, JS 2/15/16 @ 9am.  Defense renews bond motion - brief arguments heard.  Deft's bond motion is denied.  Oral demand for speedy trial made today.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA KR Wells

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  The videotapes have been rec'd & reviewed by Atty. Bates.  He advises the court that there is no resolution and a Ludwig hearing was conducted.  Jury selection remains on the calendar for 11/30/15 @ 9:00.  Clerk D. Smith.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Defense counsel has not received all the discovery to date; FPT adj to 11/9/15 @ 2:30pm.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion.  Deft's bond motion is denied.
to Modify Bond filed by Atty Gregory Bates.  (Hearing 10/21/15 at 10:00.)
Scheduling Order

Defendant Tyrone R. Johnson appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
